item.title: Mary add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Mary add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Mary add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Mary add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Mary add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Mary add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mary add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Mary add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Mary add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Wicked people never have time for reading. It's one of the reasons for their wickedness." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Mary add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "I suppose I'll have to add the force of gravity to my list of enemies." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Mary add a quote by Will Rogers
item.description: "Diplomacy is the art of saying ‘nice doggie’ until you can find a rock." -- Will Rogers

item.title: Mary add a quote by Abigail Adams
item.description: "I hate to complain...No one is without difficulties, whether in high or low life, and every person knows best where their own shoe pinches." -- Abigail Adams

item.title: Mary add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "My father taught me to work, but not to love it. I never did like to work, and I don't deny it. I'd rather read, tell stories, crack jokes, talk, laugh -- anything but work." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Mary add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "What is Man? Man is a noisome bacillus whom Our Heavenly Father created because he was disappointed in the monkey." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Mary add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I believe in Christianity as I believe that the sun has risen: not only because I see it, but because by it I see everything else." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Mary add a quote by Sophocles
item.description: "One word Frees us of all the weight and pain of life: That word is love." -- Sophocles

item.title: Mary add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "How do I love thee? Let me count the ways. I love thee to the depth and breadth and height My soul can reach" -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Mary add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Certain motherfuckers think they can fuck with my shit, but you can't kill the Rooster. You might can fuck him up some times, but, bitch, nobody kills the motherfucking Rooster. You know what I'm saying?" -- David Sedaris

item.title: Mary add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "When shit brings you down, just say 'fuck it', and eat yourself some motherfucking candy." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Mary add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "In order to get the things I want, it helps me to pretend I’m a figure in a daytime drama, a schemer. Soap opera characters make emphatic pronouncements. They ball up their fists and state their goals out loud. ‘I will destroy Buchanan Enterprises,’ they say. ‘Phoebe Wallingford will pay for what she’s done to our family.’ Walking home with the back half of the twelve-foot ladder, I turned to look in the direction of Hugh’s loft. ‘You will be mine,’ I commanded." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Mary add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Weird doors open. People fall into things." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Mary add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "I don't deserve any credit for turning the other cheek as my tongue is always in it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Mary add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "You may not control all the events that happen to you, but you can decide not to be reduced by them." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Mary add a quote by James Branch Cabell
item.description: "The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true." -- James Branch Cabell

item.title: Mary add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "I'm not young enough to know everything." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Mary add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Well-read people are less likely to be evil." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Mary add a quote by Isadora Duncan
item.description: "You were once wild here. Don’t let them tame you." -- Isadora Duncan

item.title: Mary add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Joy is the best makeup." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Mary add a quote by W.B. Yeats
item.description: "For he would be thinking of love Till the stars had run away And the shadows eaten the moon." -- W.B. Yeats

item.title: Mary add a quote by Allen Ginsberg
item.description: "Follow your inner moonlight; don't hide the madness." -- Allen Ginsberg
